panels.description: The maximum number of threads allowed in the worker task thread pool. Depending on the pool implementation, when this limit is reached tasks which cannot be queued may be rejected. This can be configured using the 'task-max-threads' attribute; see the description of that attribute for details on how this value is determined.

panels.description: Displays the number of classes that are currently loaded in the Java virtual machine.
panels.title: Current Loaded Class Count

panels.description: Displays the total number of classes that have been loaded since the Java virtual machine has started execution.
panels.title: Total Loaded Class Count

panels.description: Displays the total number of classes unloaded since the Java virtual machine has started execution.
panels.title: Total Unloaded Class Count

panels.description: Displays the number of processors available to the Java virtual machine. This value may change during a particular invocation of the virtual machine.
panels.title: Available Processors

panels.description: Displays the "recent cpu usage" for the Java Virtual Machine process.
panels.title: Process CPU Load

panels.description: Displays the CPU time used by the process on which the Java virtual machine is running in nanoseconds
panels.title: Process CPU Time

panels.description: Displays the system load average for the last minute. The system load average is the sum of the number of runnable entities queued to the available processors and the number of runnable entities running on the available processors averaged over a period of time. The way in which the load average is calculated is operating system specific but is typically a damped time-dependent average. If the load average is not available, a negative value is displayed. This attribute is designed to provide a hint about the system load and may be queried frequently. The load average may be unavailable on some platform where it is expensive to implement this method.
panels.title: System Load Average

panels.description: Displays the approximate accumulated collection elapsed time in milliseconds. This attribute displays -1 if the collection elapsed time is undefined for this collector. The Java virtual machine implementation may use a high resolution timer to measure the elapsed time. This attribute may display the same value even if the collection count has been incremented if the collection elapsed time is very short.
panels.title: Garbage Collection Time

panels.description: Displays the total number of collections that have occurred. This attribute lists -1 if the collection count is undefined for this collector.
panels.title: Garbage Collection Count

panels.description: Displays the uptime of the Java virtual machine
panels.title: JVM Uptime

panels.description: Displays the amount of memory that is committed for the Java virtual machine to use.
panels.title: Committed Heap Memory

panels.description: Displays the amount of memory that is committed for the Java virtual machine to use.
panels.title: Committed Non Heap Memory

panels.description: Displays the maximum amount of memory in bytes that can be used for memory management.
panels.title: Max Heap Memory

panels.description: Displays the maximum amount of memory in bytes that can be used for memory management.
panels.title: Max Non Heap Memory

panels.description: Displays the amount of used memory.
panels.title: Used Heap Memory

panels.description: Displays the amount of used memory.
panels.title: Used Non Heap Memory

panels.description: Number of currently deployed threads
panels.title: Current Thread count

panels.description: Displays the current number of live daemon threads.
panels.title: Daemon Thread Count

panels.description: Displays the peak live thread count since the Java virtual machine started or peak was reset. This includes daemon and non-daemon threads.
panels.title: Peak Thread Count

title: SmallRye MicroProfile Metrics 2021-06-02 13:25:36 UTC
